alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Kootenai (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 6:00PM MDT until May 28 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner and Kootenai. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall rates in excess of an inch per hour have been observed with storms in the area this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spirit Lake and Twin Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
